title: On the topic of surveys
body:
So i got a survey thing from riot, i'm filling it out, and i constantly run into shittily worded questions.

http://image.prntscr.com/image/21d4277c939943b7a7f7dbf637bddcf5.png

This question is so loaded that it hurts me because disagreeing with this statement is saying "riot puts no effort into the game." which isn't true, if your going to keep giving us loaded ass questions, can we please PLEASE have a comment section on each individual section of these shitty questions you give us?

Because this is just the first one i screenshotted, i ran into several similar questions that i have the same feeling over.

replies.body:
Because some poor rito employee got the shtty job of contributing to the statistical analysis of the community by crafting this wonderful survey.

AND THEY CHANNELLED THAT SHTTYNESS INTO THE CONTENT OF THIS AMAZING FEEDBACK FORM

I used the comments section like this:

"Hello Rito employee, you've done a good effort, but all these questions just make you guys seem **** paranoid. There's only three things I'd be interested in.

1. Would I promote this game to my friends Y/N (Net promoter score)
2. Would I spend money on access to released content Y/N (Market share)
3. Would I continue to play and support the game year  Y/N (Subscriber base)

Any no answers and you need to do some digging.

Anything else seems like a bunch of self-assuring fluff. Like a **** mutt asking for a pat on the head and a dog treat. WELL YOU'RE NOT A DOG. YOU'RE A WOLF.  WOLVES DONT ASK FOR REASSURANCE. WOLVES BUTCHER SHEEP. GO BUTCHER SOME **** SHEEP."

Oh more than making a profit of course.

That's why they make skins for popular champs over all the champs.

This is actually so true if you think about Tobi's (Tobias Fate) rise to popularity with his picture of gangplank with kano's mechanical eye. since he's rising up gangplank sees more play so they might of gotten the idea for Dreadnova from that. this is only my guess though

I got invited to a survey today. Gave Rito a piece of my mind, not that it matters.

And yes, I did get the "keeps their promises" one. Not only that, but it even asked my why I answered the way I did.

Yeah same.

It's like they think that anyone uninformed enough to answer agree means anything.

And i just found one that i actually laughed out loud at.
